meanings.definition: A person who understands or penetrates the depths of something.
meanings.sent1: She is a skilled fathomer of human emotions.
meanings.sent2: The fathomer of mysteries, he solved the case in no time.
meanings.sent3: The little girl claimed to be a fathomer of bedtime excuses.
meanings.sent4: As a fathomer of the sea, he navigated the stormy waters with ease.
meanings.sent5: The wise owl was known as the fathomer of the forest's secrets.

meanings.definition: To understand or comprehend the depth or meaning of something.
meanings.sent1: After hours of study, she finally began to fathomer the complex equation.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't fathomer why the cat always hid under the bed.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fathomer the behavior of cats can be quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: She fathomed the truth behind his smile with a single glance.
meanings.sent5: The old wise man seemed to fathomer the thoughts of everyone he met.
